com.ipt.ebsa.manage.deploy.impl

Class DependencyManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ipt.ebsa.manage.deploy.impl.DependencyManager

  • public class DependencyManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains logic for working out dependency chains so that they can be used in deployment logic. It works off the ComponentDeploymntData and does two passes through the data. The first is to go and find all of the upstream and downstream dependencies of all of the components and the second is to put them all together into chains which can be traversed.

    • Method Detail

      • applyDependencyChains

        public void applyDependencyChains(java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> chains,
                         Deployment deployment)
        This function looks at all of the deployment actions in context of all the other deployment actions to find out if there are any deployment actions which affect other components. An excellent example is two components which are joined together in a dependency chain. If one of the components is being redeployed and the rules for these components mean that the chain needs to be installed end to end then we need to uninstall all the components in the chain in order and redeploy them again in order just to affect the change that we need.
        Parameters:
        components - dependency tree
        deployment - object

      • componentInChain

        private boolean componentInChain(java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> chain,
                       ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId componentId)
        Returns:
        true if the component appears in the tree, false if not.

      • traverseTheTree

        private void traverseTheTree(java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> chain,
                   Deployment deployment,
                   ComponentDeploymentData component,
                   DependencyManager.Choice choice,
                   boolean updateWholeTree,
                   java.lang.String logPrefix)
        Top to bottom tree traversal which adds sub tasks into the entries it finds. If the "all" flag is true from the start then all components will have subtasks added if they have not been added already. If the "all" flag is not true from the start then it will become true as soon as it gets to the component in question. This is how we add the tasks to either the entire tree of just the dependencies upstream of the component.
        Parameters:
        chain - Representation of the full component object graph
        components - The full set of components in the graph
        component - The component currently being considered (where dependents-only chain behaviour is in play, this is the component which will mark the start in the chain from which dependents will be updated)
        choice - The deployment action to take.
        updateWholeTree - Indicates whether the whole tree should be updated (for whole-chain transitions) or not (for dependents-only transitions)
        logPrefix -

      • addSubTasks

        private void addSubTasks(Deployment deployment,
               DependencyManager.Choice choice,
               ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId componentId)

        This is the main entry point into this class. the components map needs to be populated with components
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • populateChains

        private void populateChains(java.util.Map<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,ComponentDeploymentData> components,
                  java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> dependencyChains,
                  java.lang.String logPrefix)
        Entry point to a recursive set of methods which populates all of the dependency chains for all of the components
        Parameters:
        components - The raw component data to create the component graph from
        dependencyChains - The component graph
        logPrefix -

      • populateDependencyChainsUpwards

        private void populateDependencyChainsUpwards(java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> dependencyGraph,
                                   ComponentDeploymentData value,
                                   java.lang.String prefix,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId> breadcrumbTrail)
        Recursive method to follow dependency chains upwards and then follow them down again. It returns the count of the number of places that this component is from the top of its tree
        Parameters:
        dependencyGraph - The component dependency graph.
        value - The component currently under inspection, used as the starting point from which to move up or down then chain.
        prefix - logging prefix.
        breadcrumbTrail - List of components already seen (in the order they were seen) whilst moving up (or down) the chain.

      • populateDependencyChainsDownwards

        private void populateDependencyChainsDownwards(java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> dependencyGraph,
                                     java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,java.util.TreeMap<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId,?>> parentInChain,
                                     ComponentDeploymentData value,
                                     java.lang.String prefix,
                                     int depth,
                                     java.util.LinkedList<ComponentDeploymentData.ComponentId> breadcrumbTrail)
        Another recursive method, this time to follow dependency chains downwards. Note the behaviour of the depth parameter. If this component has previously been set to a deeper depth then the depth jumps to the deeper level
        Parameters:
        dependencyGraph - The full dependency graph.
        parentInChain - A top level component in the graph (ie. one which has no depdencies of its own, but is depended on by others).
        value - The component currently being considered.
        prefix - logging prefix.
        depth - The depth of value in comparison to the top level component.
        breadcrumbTrail - The list of components we've already encountered.
